p: The A. millefolium EO showed antimicrobial activity in vitro against Streptococcus pneumoniae, Clostridium perfringens, C. albicans, C. krusei, Mycobacterium smegmatis and Acinetobacter lwoffii [ 88]. Additionally, in vitro antibacterial activity against nine Gram positive and negative bacteria ( S. epidermidis, S. aureus, B. cereus, E. faecalis, E. coli, P. aeruginosa, K. pneumoniae, S. typhimurium and Shigella dysenteria) demonstrated that A. millefolium EO can potentially be used for controlling certain bacteria that cause many infectious diseases, but its effectiveness varied in different regions because of the differences in EO composition [ 87].
